Operation 'AddIp' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks critical details about request format, response content, and side effects (activation requirement, inventory addition). Added domain-specific context about IP activation and pool assignment for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: **This endpoint is for adding a(n) IP Address(es) to your account.**
data.summary_suggestion: Add dedicated IP address(es) to account
data.description_suggestion: Adds one or more dedicated IP addresses to your SendGrid account. Accepts an array of IP addresses in the request body. Returns the newly added IP address(es) with their configuration details. After adding, IPs must be activated before they can be used for sending email. Added IPs will appear in your account's IP inventory and can be assigned to IP pools.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks critical details about request format, response content, and side effects (activation requirement, inventory addition). Added domain-specific context about IP activation and pool assignment for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'GetIp' has semantic quality issues: unclear_purpose, missing_output_details. Original summary is misleading - endpoint returns more than just pool assignments. Description lacks clarity about what data is actually returned. Enhanced to clarify that it retrieves full IP details including pools, warm-up status, and configuration, making it clearer for AI agents to understand the operation's full scope.

data.current_summary: Retrieve all IP pools an IP address belongs to
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to see which IP pools a particular IP address has been added to.**

The same IP address can be added to multiple IP pools.

A single IP address or a range of IP addresses may be dedicated to an account in order to send email for multiple domains. The reputation of this IP is based on the aggregate performance of all the senders who use it.
data.summary_suggestion: Get IP address details and pool assignments
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific IP address, including its pool assignments, warm-up status, and configuration. Returns the IP address object with all associated metadata. The same IP can belong to multiple IP pools for organizing email traffic by type (marketing, transactional, etc.). Requires the IP address as a path parameter.
data.reasoning: Original summary is misleading - endpoint returns more than just pool assignments. Description lacks clarity about what data is actually returned. Enhanced to clarify that it retrieves full IP details including pools, warm-up status, and configuration, making it clearer for AI agents to understand the operation's full scope.

message: Operation 'ListAssignedIp' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and appropriate. Description is vague about what 'assigned' means and lacks details about response content. Enhanced to clarify that assigned IPs are those with active assignments to account/subusers, and specified what metadata is returned to help AI agents understand the distinction from the general ListIp operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve only assigned IP addresses.**

A single IP address or a range of IP addresses may be dedicated to an account in order to send email for multiple domains. The reputation of this IP is based on the aggregate performance of all the senders who use it.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all IP addresses currently assigned to your account or subusers. Returns only IPs with active assignments, excluding unassigned IPs. Each returned IP includes assignment details, warm-up status, associated pools, and assigned subuser information. This is useful for viewing only the IPs actively in use for sending email.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and appropriate. Description is vague about what 'assigned' means and lacks details about response content. Enhanced to clarify that assigned IPs are those with active assignments to account/subusers, and specified what metadata is returned to help AI agents understand the distinction from the general ListIp operation.

message: Operation 'CreateIpPool' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and appropriate. Description focuses on UI steps rather than API requirements. Enhanced to specify request requirements (pool name), response content (pool object), and side effects (empty pool creation, IP activation prerequisite). Clarified the purpose of IP pools for AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create an IP pool.**

Before you can create an IP pool, you need to activate the IP in your SendGrid account: 

1. Log into your SendGrid account.  
1. Navigate to **Settings** and then select **IP Addresses**.  
1. Find the IP address you want to activate and then click **Edit**.  
1. Check **Allow my account to send mail using this IP address**.
1. Click **Save**.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new IP pool for organizing dedicated IP addresses. Requires a pool name in the request body. Returns the newly created IP pool object with its configuration. The pool starts empty and can have IP addresses added to it after creation. IP addresses must be activated in your account before they can be added to pools. IP pools allow you to group IPs for sending different types of email (marketing, transactional, etc.) from separate IP addresses.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and appropriate. Description focuses on UI steps rather than API requirements. Enhanced to specify request requirements (pool name), response content (pool object), and side effects (empty pool creation, IP activation prerequisite). Clarified the purpose of IP pools for AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'ListIpPool' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description is too minimal and lacks details about response structure and use cases. Enhanced to specify what data is returned (pool names, creation dates, assigned IPs) and clarified the operation's purpose for AI agent interpretation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to get all of your IP pools.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all IP pools configured in your SendGrid account. Returns an array of IP pool objects, each containing the pool name, creation date, and list of IP addresses assigned to that pool. Use this to view your complete IP pool inventory and their current configurations.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description is too minimal and lacks details about response structure and use cases. Enhanced to specify what data is returned (pool names, creation dates, assigned IPs) and clarified the operation's purpose for AI agent interpretation.

data.current_summary: Retrieve all the IPs in a specified pool
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to get all of the IP addresses that are in a specific IP pool.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific IP pool, including all IP addresses currently assigned to it. Returns the pool object with pool name, creation date, and a complete list of member IP addresses with their individual status and configuration. Requires the pool name as a path parameter.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description is minimal and lacks details about response structure and parameters. Enhanced to specify what data is returned (pool details, member IPs, status info) and clarified the path parameter requirement for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to update the name of an IP pool.**
data.description_suggestion: Updates the name of an existing IP pool. Requires the current pool name as a path parameter and the new pool name in the request body. Returns the updated IP pool object with the new name. This operation does not affect IP addresses assigned to the pool.
data.reasoning: Original description is minimal and lacks actionable details. Added clarity about required inputs (current pool name, new name), expected output (updated pool object), and side effects (name change only, IPs unaffected). message: Operation 'DeleteIpPool' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and actionable. Description lacks critical details about prerequisites (pool must be empty), expected response code, and irreversibility. Added these details to help AI agents understand constraints and consequences of this destructive operation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete an IP pool.**
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an IP pool by name. Requires the pool name as a path parameter. The pool must be empty (no IP addresses assigned) before deletion. Returns a 204 No Content response on success. This operation cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description lacks critical details about prerequisites (pool must be empty), expected response code, and irreversibility. Added these details to help AI agents understand constraints and consequences of this destructive operation.

message: Operation 'DeleteIpFromIpPool' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and actionable. data.current_summary: Remove an IP address from a pool
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to remove an IP address from an IP pool.**
data.description_suggestion: Removes an IP address from an IP pool. Requires the pool name and IP address as path parameters. Returns a 204 No Content response on success. The IP address remains active in your SendGrid account and can be added to other pools. This operation does not delete the IP address itself.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description is too minimal and lacks important details about response format, what happens to the IP after removal, and clarification that this is a pool membership operation, not IP deletion. Added these details for better AI agent understanding of the operation's scope and effects.

data.current_description: **This endpoint gets amount of IP Addresses that can still be created during a given period and the price of those IPs.**
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve remaining IP purchase quota and pricing
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the number of dedicated IP addresses that can still be purchased during the current billing period and their associated cost. Returns an object containing the remaining IP count and price per IP. This helps determine your account's IP purchasing capacity and budget requirements.
data.reasoning: Original summary is vague about what 'remaining IPs' means in context. Description has grammatical issues and lacks clarity about return format. Improved summary to clarify this is about purchase quota and pricing. Enhanced description with better grammar, explicit mention of return object structure, and context about use case (capacity and budget planning).

message: Operation 'GetIp' has semantic quality issues: unclear_purpose, missing_output_details. Original summary is misleading - endpoint returns more than just pool assignments. data.current_summary: Retrieve all IP pools an IP address belongs to
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to see which IP pools a particular IP address has been added to.**

The same IP address can be added to multiple IP pools.

A single IP address or a range of IP addresses may be dedicated to an account in order to send email for multiple domains. The reputation of this IP is based on the aggregate performance of all the senders who use it.
data.summary_suggestion: Get IP address details and pool assignments
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific IP address, including its pool assignments, warm-up status, and configuration. Returns the IP address object with all associated metadata. The same IP can belong to multiple IP pools for organizing email traffic by type (marketing, transactional, etc.). Requires the IP address as a path parameter.
data.reasoning: Original summary is misleading - endpoint returns more than just pool assignments. Description lacks clarity about what data is actually returned. Enhanced to clarify that it retrieves full IP details including pools, warm-up status, and configuration, making it clearer for AI agents to understand the operation's full scope.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve only assigned IP addresses.**

A single IP address or a range of IP addresses may be dedicated to an account in order to send email for multiple domains. The reputation of this IP is based on the aggregate performance of all the senders who use it.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all IP addresses currently assigned to your account or subusers. Returns only IPs with active assignments, excluding unassigned IPs. Each returned IP includes assignment details, warm-up status, associated pools, and assigned subuser information. This is useful for viewing only the IPs actively in use for sending email.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and appropriate. Description is vague about what 'assigned' means and lacks details about response content. Enhanced to clarify that assigned IPs are those with active assignments to account/subusers, and specified what metadata is returned to help AI agents understand the distinction from the general ListIp operation.

message: Operation 'CreateIpPool' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and appropriate. Description focuses on UI steps rather than API requirements. Enhanced to specify request requirements (pool name), response content (pool object), and side effects (empty pool creation, IP activation prerequisite). data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create an IP pool.**

Before you can create an IP pool, you need to activate the IP in your SendGrid account: 

1. Log into your SendGrid account.  
1. Navigate to **Settings** and then select **IP Addresses**.  
1. Find the IP address you want to activate and then click **Edit**.  
1. Check **Allow my account to send mail using this IP address**.
1. Click **Save**.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new IP pool for organizing dedicated IP addresses. Requires a pool name in the request body. Returns the newly created IP pool object with its configuration. The pool starts empty and can have IP addresses added to it after creation. IP addresses must be activated in your account before they can be added to pools. IP pools allow you to group IPs for sending different types of email (marketing, transactional, etc.) from separate IP addresses.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and appropriate. Description focuses on UI steps rather than API requirements. Enhanced to specify request requirements (pool name), response content (pool object), and side effects (empty pool creation, IP activation prerequisite). Clarified the purpose of IP pools for AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to update the name of an IP pool.**
data.description_suggestion: Updates the name of an existing IP pool. Requires the current pool name as a path parameter and the new pool name in the request body. Returns the updated IP pool object with the new name. This operation does not affect IP addresses assigned to the pool.
data.reasoning: Original description is minimal and lacks actionable details. Added clarity about required inputs (current pool name, new name), expected output (updated pool object), and side effects (name change only, IPs unaffected). data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete an IP pool.**
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an IP pool by name. Requires the pool name as a path parameter. The pool must be empty (no IP addresses assigned) before deletion. Returns a 204 No Content response on success. This operation cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description lacks critical details about prerequisites (pool must be empty), expected response code, and irreversibility. Added these details to help AI agents understand constraints and consequences of this destructive operation.

data.current_summary: Remove an IP address from a pool
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to remove an IP address from an IP pool.**
data.description_suggestion: Removes an IP address from an IP pool. Requires the pool name and IP address as path parameters. Returns a 204 No Content response on success. The IP address remains active in your SendGrid account and can be added to other pools. This operation does not delete the IP address itself.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description is too minimal and lacks important details about response format, what happens to the IP after removal, and clarification that this is a pool membership operation, not IP deletion. Added these details for better AI agent understanding of the operation's scope and effects.
